status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Use DirectoryStream in DiskChecker#checkDirs to detect errors when listing a directory

This message was automatically generated.

Hi, [~zxu] Thanks for updating the patch.

bq. I tried, but it is failed with "Not a directory" exception at DiskChecker#checkDirAccess

What would be the real problem to fix in this patch? Is the {{Null}} due to the input is a file or an IO error?

If the later is the case, would it be OK to use {{DirectoryStream}} instead of {{listFiles()}}, as it can report {{IOException}}. Also we should test against this case.

Discuss with [~eddyxu] offline, DirectoryStream need java.nio.file.Files support, which may have compatibility issue at other platforms.
We agreed to add a log for this IO error and rename testCheckDirs to testCheckDirsFailedWhenListDirs. thanks [~eddyxu] for the thorough review. I uploaded a new patch HADOOP-12056.002.patch which addressed these issues. Please review it.

\\
\\

This message was automatically generated.
Hmm, what's the potential issue with using DirectoryStream? I see we already use it in IOUtils, and it seems to have a Windows implementation.

Hi [~andrew.wang], that is good information, I thought no one use DirectoryStream in hadoop code base yet. Yes, IOUtils used it already. I will use {{DirectoryStream}} to fix this issue, which will give more detail message from the IOException as [~eddyxu] suggested in previous comment.
Hi [~andrew.wang], I attached a new patch HADOOP-12056.003.patch, which use {{DirectoryStream}} instead of {{listFiles}}. Please review it. Many thanks.

\\

+1 LGTM, thanks Zhihai. Will commit shortly.
Hi, [~zxu] Thanks much for updating the patch. +1 (non-binding).
Committed to trunk and branch-2. Thanks for the patch Zhihai, and Eddy for also reviewing.
